intro: Hemizonia fasciculata var. lobbii, commonly known as the Lobb's hemizonia, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its distinctive features include narrow, linear leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
